epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight (quarries) or m続 of concrete (batching plant); economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good across all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

transport.average_transport_distance: 12.22 km from manufacturing gate to site

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

assumptions.deconstruction: Physical process using hydraulic excavator; diesel use modeled from ecoinvent v3.9.1
assumptions.recycling_rate: 80% recycled based on 2022 National Waste Report

end_of_life.module_d_benefits: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete; recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime (reabsorption)
carbonation.consideration: Not included in this EPD; recommended to consider in whole-of-life building studies per BS EN 16757:2017

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_method: According to PCR 2019:14 for co-produced goods; fly ash and silica fume treated as waste with transport impacts only; slag allocated economically

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

NSW_ACT.sources: Black coal (75%), photovoltaic (17%), natural gas (3%), hydropower (3%), others (2%)

QLD.sources: Black coal (71%), natural gas (12%), photovoltaic (8%), oil (4%), others (5%)

SA.sources: Wind power (61%), natural gas (34%), photovoltaic (4%), others (1%)

VIC.sources: Natural gas (44%), brown coal (41%), wind power (8%), hydropower (3%), others (4%)

WA.sources: Natural gas (65%), wind power (26%), black coal (8%), others (1%)

disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Some impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground.
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V4.0 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
